state.content:
You are given few useful crafting recipes to craft items in Minecraft. Crafting commands are of the format "craft [target object] using [input ingredients]".
Every round I will give you an observation, you have to respond an action based on the state and instruction. You can "get" an object (ingredients) from the inventory or the environment, look-up the game inventory by "inventory", or "craft" (target) using any of the crafting commands. You can use ONLY these crafting commands provided, do not use your own crafting commands. However, if the crafting command uses a generic ingredient like "planks", you can use special types of the same ingredient e.g. "dark oak planks" in the command instead.
Your response should use the following format:

Thought:
 ... 

Action:
 ...

Crafting commands:
craft 1 observer using 1 quartz, 2 redstone, 6 cobblestone
craft 6 detector rail using 1 redstone, 1 stone pressure plate, 6 iron ingot
craft 1 note block using 8 planks, 1 redstone
craft 1 redstone block using 9 redstone
craft 1 redstone torch using 1 stick, 1 redstone
craft 1 dispenser using 1 redstone, 7 cobblestone, 1 bow
craft 1 clock using 4 gold ingot, 1 redstone
craft 6 powered rail using 1 redstone, 1 stick, 6 gold ingot
craft 1 piston using 1 redstone, 4 cobblestone, 3 planks, 1 iron ingot
craft 1 redstone lamp using 4 redstone, 1 glowstone

Goal: craft redstone block.

Thought:
To craft a redstone block, I need 9 redstone. I will check my inventory to see if I have enough redstone.

Action:
inventory
Inventory: You are not carrying anything.

Thought:
I have no redstone in my inventory. I need to gather redstone from the environment in order to craft the redstone block.

Action:
get 9 redstone

Thought:
I now have the 9 redstone needed to craft a redstone block.

Action:
craft 1 redstone block using 9 redstone
